authors.name: Andrea R Daniel
authors.note: This protocol was adapted from the work of Brian Cosgrove and Lexi Bounds in the Gersbach lab at Duke University.

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fhqf2","text":"This protocol describes methods for a CRISPR screen to identify motifs in the MYH9 intron 3 mechanoenhancer that control MYH9 expression.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: CRISPR, MYH9, enhancer, mechanoenhancer, extracellular matrix
manuscript_citation: {"blocks":[{"key":"8takq","text":"Mechanosensitive genomic enhancers potentiate the cellular response to matrix stiffness","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":87}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":87}],"data":{}},{"key":"4h4dp","text":"Brian D. Cosgrove, Lexi R. Bounds, Carson Key Taylor, Alan L. Su, Anthony J. Rizzo, Alejandro Barrera, Gregory E. Crawford, Brenton D. Hoffman, Charles A. Gersbach","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1pn25","text":"bioRxiv 2024.01.10.574997; doi: https://doi.org/10.1101/2024.01.10.574997","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"2F19A2EAB4A211EE951B0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2024.01.10.574997v1"}}}}

S. Weissman, Compact and highly active next-generation libraries for CRISPR-mediated gene repression and activation. Yao, J. Tycko, J. W. Oh, L. R. Bounds, S. J. Gosai, L. Lataniotis, A. Mackay-Smith, B. R. Doughty, I. Gabdank, H. Schmidt, I. Youngworth, K. Andreeva, X. Ren, A. Barrera, Y. Luo, K. Siklenka, G. G. Yardımcı, R. Tewhey, A. Kundaje, W. J.\nGreenleaf, P. C. Sabeti, C. Leslie, Y. Pritykin, J. E. Moore, M. A. Beer, C. A. Gersbach, T. E. Reddy, Y. Shen, J. M. Engreitz, M. C. Bassik, S. K. Reilly, The ENCODE4 Consortium, Multi-center integrated analysis of non-coding CRISPR screens, , doi:10.1101/2022.12.21.520137.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a8l3o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ac3nh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"33s5h","text":"For the MYH9 intron 3 pRE saturation mutagenesis library, we include any gRNA that are within the hit pRE from the MYH9 locus library (from our previous CRISPRi stiffness-responsive screen), which resulted in 64 gRNA across the library. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"59jno","text":"Include 25 non-targeting gRNA (1) and 11 safe-targeting gRNA (2) as negative controls. This combined gRNA library of 100 gRNA is synthesized as an oligo pool by Twist Biosciences with common overhangs for cloning into a lentiviral backbone.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"etai5","text":"This oligo pool is PCR amplified. pLV_hU6-sgRNA_hUbC-GFP-P2A-PuroR (Addgene plasmid #162335) is then digested with Esp3I, gel purified, and then ligated along with the amplified oligo pool by Gibson assembly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ms2g","text":"Following a 1x SPRI cleaning, the Gibson assembly is transformed into Endura competent cells (Lucigen) according to the manufacturer's protocol, and cultured overnight before maxi-prepping the\ngRNA-library plasmid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d1r0t","text":"A PCR amplicon across the gRNA region of the resulting plasmid is sequenced to a depth of ~100k-1M read pairs on an Illumina miSeq in order to verify coverage across the entire gRNA library.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6u5n2","text":"gRNA library plasmid pool is co-transfected into ~7.8M HEK293T cells along with two lentiviral packaging plasmids using Lipofectamine 3000 (ThermoFisher).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e7e6d","text":"20 hours post-transfection, the transfection media is removed and fresh growth media added. Media containing viral particles is removed one day later at 48 hours post-transfection and stored, replaced with fresh media and collected one day later and stored at 4C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f3mel","text":"Combined media containing viral particles is filtered through 0.45 μm low-protein binding filters, and then concentrated using Lenti-X Concentrator (Takara Bio) according to the manufacturer’s protocol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8n7m8","text":"Functional titering to determine MOI is performed by transducing HFF (human neonate fibroblast) cells across a 0.75x-100x dilution range of the viral stock, and then subjecting the cells to FACS-based cell sorting to identify what percent of the population is mCherry+ for each viral stock dilution. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ac1hc","text":"HFF cells are transduced with a lentiviral SpCas9 construct [FUGW-SpCas9-2A-HygroR (pVG54)], selected with 100ug/mL hygromycin for 4 days with hygromycin in order to make a stable line. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2cgh3","text":"Following four passages the cells are frozen and used for subsequent screening experiments and validations. 600k HFF cells are transduced with lentivirus encoding the MYH9 intron 3 saturation pool. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2jq5g","text":"For screening cells are cultured for 8 days.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6gepm","text":"Cells are trypsinization with 0.25% Trypsin-EDTA for 5 minutes at 37C. Trypsin is neutralized with 1X volumes of complete growth media, cells are centrifuged at 300g for 5 minutes, and the supernatant aspirated. The cells are rinsed once with 1X volume PBS followed by another centrifugation and aspiration leaving 200uL of PBS above the pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f0j1b","text":"The eBioScience ICC Fixation kit (ThermoFisher) is used to fix/permeabilize cells according to manufacturer’s instructions. Note, equilibrate reagents to room temp prior to usage. To fix cells, add 500uL eBioSciences Fix/Perm Buffer (ThermoFisher) to the 200uL PBS and pellet, and incubate at room temperature for 20 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3sd55","text":"Add 1X Permeabilization Buffer up to 8mL total volume, spin at 600g for 5 minutes, and add perm buffer rinse.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cu5ru","text":"HFF cells are incubated for 30 minutes at room temperature in the dark on a nutating rocker, spun 600g for 5 minutes spin, followed by two repeats of 3mL 1X Perm Buffer rinse/spin cycles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8pstq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6npub","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"70d17","text":"Cells were resuspended in FACS Buffer [1X PBS supplemented w/ 1% BSA (Sigma) and 0.5mM EDTA (Sigma)] at a density of ~9M cells/mL and sorted. A SH800 Cell Sorter (Sony Biotechnologies) is used to separate out the top/bottom-expressing MYH9 fractions following immunostaining. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"701qh","text":"Single channel expressing cell populations are used to set up compensation panels. These include untreated cells, antibody-only cells, mCherry-only cells. The top 10% and lower 10% of the MYH9 population is sorted and used for downstream gRNA-enrichment analysis and sequencing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2c5rk","text":"Sorted cells are counted and DNA extracted form the fixed cells using the PicoPure DNA extraction kit (ThermoFisher) according to the manufacturer's protocol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"tgd1","text":"Next, gRNA PCR and processing for enrichment across the low and high MYH9 expression bins is performed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: MYH9 intron 3 saturation mutagenesis screening
